triageFlags.title: Vehicle Age Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.expectedValue: Maximum 96 months at the end of the agreement
triageFlags.description: The vehicle's age at the start of the agreement exceeds the policy's maximum allowable age.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider adjusting the term or selecting a newer vehicle to comply with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the vehicle's age at the start of the agreement must not exceed 8 years (96 months). The current vehicle age is 92 months, and with a 60-month term, it will exceed the maximum allowable age at the end of the agreement.

triageFlags.title: Applicant in Tier B Credit Score Band
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier B, requiring stricter affordability checks.
triageFlags.recommendation: Ensure all affordability checks are thoroughly conducted and consider additional security measures.
triageFlags.reasoning: The applicant's credit score of 627 places them in Tier B, which requires stricter affordability checks as per the policy.

content.reasoning: The analysis identified that the vehicle's age at the start of the agreement exceeds the policy limit, and the applicant's credit score places them in Tier B, necessitating stricter affordability checks. These factors elevate the risk level to medium.
